strings.xml_iso19139: Save this metadata as an ISO19139 XML file
strings.xml_iso19139Tooai_dc: Save this metadata as an OAI Dublin Core XML file
strings.linkToPortal-help: Full access to the portal and metadata.
strings.citationProposal-help: This proposal was automatically generated, check if the metadata authors did not specified custom citation requirements.
strings.invalidElement: Invalid element. Invalid content was found starting with element:
strings.missingElement: Missing element. The content of element:
strings.notValidFor: is not a valid value for
strings.enum2: is not valid for the field
strings.add-resource-idHelp: Compose the resource identifier using the catalog URL and the metadata identifier (eg. http://www.organization.org/catalogue/5391bf69-44bc-4ea0-8cc0-6cf6c3bc81ae).
strings.add-extent-from-geokeywordsHelp: Analyze each keyword of type place and add matching extent.
strings.sds-add-dataqualityHelp: TG4: For each spatial data service, there shall be one and only one set of quality information (dataQualityInfo element) scoped to “service”.
strings.sds-add-tech-specHelp: TG8: The Specification metadata element shall at least refer to or contain one technical specification to which the invocable spatial data service fully conforms, providing all the necessary technical elements, to actually invoke the service and enable its usage.
strings.sds-add-qualityofservice: Add missing Quality of Service criteria
strings.sds-add-qualityofserviceHelp: INSPIRE SDS requires three quality of service criteria to be reported in the metadata: Availability, Performance and Capacity. This button will add the missing criteria.
strings.sds-fix-categoryHelp: (Rec1) Replace gco:CharacterString with gmx:Anchor in the description metadata element.
strings.sds-addNoConstraintsHelp: Add an element that documents that there are no limitation for this service.

div.p: To support the operation of UK Location and INSPIRE, discovery metadata records must include a File Identifier for the resource.

ol.li: File Identifier must be populated with a unique identifier. This may be a UUID generated by a metadata creation tool.
Once created and published to UK Location, the File Identifier must not be changed.
A change to the File Identifier would represent the creation of a new resource.
For more guidelines see Gemini Guidance

div.p: To support the operation of UK Location and INSPIRE, discovery metadata records must include a File Identifier for the resource.

ol.li: File Identifier must be populated with a unique identifier. This may be a UUID generated by a metadata creation tool.
Once created and published to UK Location, the File Identifier must not be changed.
A change to the File Identifier would represent the creation of a new resource.
For more guidelines see Gemini Guidance

div.p: Date on which the metadata was last updated, or was confirmed as being up-to-date, or if not updated, then the date it was created.

ol.li: This should be updated whenever the metadata is updated due to a change in the dataset, or when it is reviewed and confirmed as wholly correct.
For more guidelines see Gemini Guidance

div.p: Date on which the metadata was last updated, or was confirmed as being up-to-date, or if not updated, then the date it was created.

ol.li: This should be updated whenever the metadata is updated due to a change in the dataset, or when it is reviewed and confirmed as wholly correct.
For more guidelines see Gemini Guidance

div.p: This is the organisation or role in an organisation responsible for this metadata.

ol.li: Should include organisation name, delivery point, and contact email address.
For more guidelines see Gemini Guidance

div.p: This is the organisation or role in an organisation responsible for this metadata.

ol.li: Should include organisation name, delivery point, and contact email address.
For more guidelines see Gemini Guidance

div.p: Conditional, required when Resource type (ISO hierarchyLevel) is not "dataset".

ol.li: Set to an appropriate text string, or delete if not required. Use of nilreasons is not recommended.
For more guidelines see Gemini Guidance

div.p: Conditional, required when Resource type (ISO hierarchyLevel) is not "dataset".

ol.li: Set to an appropriate text string, or delete if not required. Use of nilreasons is not recommended.
For more guidelines see Gemini Guidance

div.p: Scope to which metadata applies. To distinguish between datasets, series, and services

ol.li: Choose the appropriate value from the list.
For more guidelines see Gemini Guidance

div.p: Scope to which metadata applies. To distinguish between datasets, series, and services

ol.li: Choose the appropriate value from the list.
For more guidelines see Gemini Guidance

div.p: The purpose of this element is to identify any external restrictions on access to the data such as licence arrangements.

ol.li: For INSPIRE: If no limitations apply, enter 'No limitations'.
For more guidelines see Gemini Guidance

div.p: The purpose of this element is to identify any external restrictions on access to the data such as licence arrangements.

ol.li: For INSPIRE: If no limitations apply, enter 'No limitations'.
For more guidelines see Gemini Guidance

div.p: The purpose of this element is to describe any restrictions on usage of the data (as opposed to access).

ol.li: Any known constraints should be identified. If no conditions apply, then 'no conditions apply' should be recorded.
For more guidelines see Gemini Guidance

div.p: The purpose of this element is to describe any restrictions on usage of the data (as opposed to access).

ol.li: Any known constraints should be identified. If no conditions apply, then 'no conditions apply' should be recorded.
For more guidelines see Gemini Guidance

div.p: Supports parent-child relationships in metadata. Allows navigation from a dataset record to the series record of which it forms a part.

ol.li: Only to be used if the dataset is part of a series. Delete if not required. Use of nilreasons is not recommended.
For more guidelines see Gemini Guidance

p.b: The parent identifier block has been marked as 'inapplicable' so will not be shown/

ol.li: To add a parent identifier switch to the metadata tab in full view
For more guidelines see Gemini Guidance

div.p: The purpose of this is to identify the language used in a multi-lingual metadata service, for example in the INSPIRE geo-portal.

ol.li: For more guidelines see Gemini Guidance

div.p: The abstract should provide a clear and concise statement that enables the reader to understand the content of the data or service.

ol.li: For more guidelines see Gemini Guidance

div.p: The abstract should provide a clear and concise statement that enables the reader to understand the content of the data or service.

ol.li: For more guidelines see Gemini Guidance

div.p: The purpose of this element is to record relevant information that does not clearly belong in another element.

ol.li: For more guidelines see Gemini Guidance

div.p: The purpose of this is to uniquely identify the data resource.

ol.li: For more guidelines see Gemini Guidance

div.p: The purpose of this element is to provide an indication of how detailed the spatial data is. It is equivalent to the ground sample distance. It should not be confused with the scale of a map, which is purely a display attribute (the spatial resolution should be defined in the specification of the data resource).

ol.li: For datasets and series only. For services this information should be recorded in the abstract
For more guidelines see Gemini Guidance

div.p: This element defines the geographical extent of coverage of the data resource relative to an administrative hierarchy. Use a known authority code or a linked data URI (eg data.os.uk)

ol.li: For more guidelines see Gemini Guidance

div.p: Rectangle enclosing the extent of the data resource described in latitude and longitude.

ol.li: Draw a rectangle on the map or choose a region using the region picker
For more guidelines see Gemini Guidance

div.p: Rectangle enclosing the extent of the data resource described in latitude and longitude.

ol.li: Draw a rectangle on the map or choose a region using the region picker
For more guidelines see Gemini Guidance

div.p: This element defines the geographical extent of coverage of the data resource relative to an administrative hierarchy. Use a known authority code or a linked data URI (eg data.os.uk)

ol.li: For more guidelines see Gemini Guidance

div.p: Provide a keyword to describe the general subject of the resource. Keywords should preferrably be from a controlled vocabulary, in which case the title and reference date of the vocabulary should be provided, or free text.

ol.li: For INSPIRE, at least one keyword should describe the relevant INSPIRE spatial data theme from GEMET
For more guidelines see Gemini Guidance

div.p: Provide a keyword to describe the general subject of the resource. Keywords should preferrably be from a controlled vocabulary, in which case the title and reference date of the vocabulary should be provided, or free text.

ol.li: For INSPIRE, at least one keyword should describe the relevant INSPIRE spatial data theme from GEMET
For more guidelines see Gemini Guidance

div.p: Information about the scope and frequency of updating.

ol.li: Include at least the Update Frequency, choose from the dropdown list
For more guidelines see Gemini Guidance

div.p: This informs the user about who is responsible for the data resource.

ol.li: Include at least the organisation name, delivery point, email, and role. A generic role may be given.
For more guidelines see Gemini Guidance

div.p: This informs the user about who is responsible for the data resource.

ol.li: Include at least the organisation name, delivery point, email, and role. A generic role may be given.
For more guidelines see Gemini Guidance

div.p: The purpose of this element is to identify the way in which the data is spatially referenced in the data resource. This may be by coordinates or geographic identifiers.

ol.li: For INSPIRE compliance at least EPSG 4258 should be included.
Pick an EPSG Code from the list.
For more guidelines see Gemini Guidance

div.p: The purpose of this element is to identify the way in which the data is spatially referenced in the data resource. This may be by coordinates or geographic identifiers.

ol.li: Only coordinate reference system identifiers specified in a well-known common register may be used.
Pick an EPSG Code from the list.
For more guidelines see Gemini Guidance

div.p: The type in which the spatial data is represented.

ol.li: Choose from the dropdown list.
For more guidelines see Gemini Guidance

div.p: This is the date or date range that identifies the currency of the data. It may refer to the period of collection, or the date at which it is deemed to be current. Mandatory for Datasets and Series.

ol.li: This element should not be confused with Dataset reference date which is an identifying date for the data resource.
For more guidelines see Gemini Guidance

div.p: This is the date or date range that identifies the currency of the data. It may refer to the period of collection, or the date at which it is deemed to be current.

ol.li: This element should not be confused with Dataset reference date which is an identifying date for the data resource.
For more guidelines see Gemini Guidance

div.p: The purpose of this element is to provide a readily recognisable name for the resource.

ol.li: For more guidelines see Gemini Guidance

div.p: The purpose of this element is to provide a readily recognisable name for the resource.

ol.li: For more guidelines see Gemini Guidance

div.p: This identifies the type of service.

ol.li: Choose from the dropdown list.
For more guidelines see Gemini Guidance

div.p: The purpose of this element is to provide a basic classification for the data resource.

ol.li: Choose from the search options
For more guidelines see Gemini Guidance

div.p: The purpose of this element is to describe the vertical range of the data resource (where relevant).

ol.li: Optional. Delete if not required. Use of nilreasons is not recommended.
Provide a minimum value and maximum value in the units of the provided coordinate reference system
Identify the coordinate reference system used for vertical extent measurements from the dropdown list.
For more guidelines see Gemini Guidance

div.p: The purpose of this element is to describe the vertical range of the data resource (where relevant).

ol.li: Optional. Delete if not required. Use of nilreasons is not recommended.
Provide a minimum value and maximum value in the units of the provided coordinate reference system
Identify the coordinate reference system used for vertical extent measurements from the dropdown list.
For more guidelines see Gemini Guidance

div.p: This identifies the dataset(s) associated with the service

ol.li: Conditional - mandatory for View and Download services, optional for other service types.
Identify the data resources by either an OGC CSW GetRecordById request or an address of a metadata instance in a WAF
For more guidelines see Gemini Guidance

div.p: This is the written language used for any text in the dataset.

ol.li: Choose from the dropdown list.
For more guidelines see Gemini Guidance

div.p: The character encoding used in the dataset.

ol.li: Optional if UTF8, mandatory if other
For more guidelines see Gemini Guidance

div.p: The reference date for the data resource.

ol.li: Dataset reference date is a notional date of 'publication' of the data resource. It is different from Temporal extent which is the actual date of the currency of the data.
For more guidelines see Gemini Guidance

div.p: The reference date for the data resource.

ol.li: Dataset reference date is a notional date of 'publication' of the data resource. It is different from Temporal extent which is the actual date of the currency of the data.
For more guidelines see Gemini Guidance

div.p: The format in which the digital data is provided.

ol.li: Record the format from the dropdown list, and the version (if known).
If the version is not known, record it as "unknown"
For more guidelines see Gemini Guidance

div.p: Optional for services.

The purpose of this element is to point to where the dataset or dataset series may be directly accessed online, or to an online resource providing more information about accessing the dataset or dataset series.

ol.li: Use the associated resource wizard for adding new resource locators.
Record at least the URL and the function.
For more guidelines see Gemini Guidance

div.p: The purpose of this element is to point to where the service may be directly accessed online, or to an online resource providing more information about accessing the service.

ol.li: Use the associated resource wizard.
Record at least the protocol, URL and name.
For more guidelines see Gemini Guidance

div.p: To allow quantitative description of the completeness, consistency, accuracy, and correctness of the data.

ol.li: For INSPIRE compliance at least one conformity report where the quality scope is the entire dataset or series is required.
Choose the appropriate report from the picker.
For more guidelines see Gemini Guidance
The lineage statement should indicate how the resource was created.
For more guidelines see Gemini Guidance

div.p: Statement of conformity with the product specification or user requirement against which the data is being evaluated.

ol.li: For INSPIRE compliance at least one conformity report where the quality scope is the entire service is required.
Choose the appropriate report for either Spatial Data Services or Network Services respectively from the picker.
For more guidelines see Gemini Guidance
